files.patch:
@@ -843,0 +843,7 @@
+     * @apiNote The {@code InputStream} returned by this method can wrap
+     * an {@link java.util.zip.InflaterInputStream InflaterInputStream}
+     * which leaves the contents of the output buffer beyond the
+     * last inflated byte undefined after a read operation (see {@link
+     * java.util.zip.InflaterInputStream#read(byte[], int, int)
+     * InflaterInputStream.read(byte[], int, int)}).
+     *

@@ -825,0 +825,7 @@
+     *
+     * @apiNote This method can return an {@link java.util.zip.InflaterInputStream
+     * InflaterInputStream} which leaves the contents of the output buffer beyond
+     * the last inflated byte undefined after a read operation (see {@link
+     * java.util.zip.InflaterInputStream#read(byte[], int, int)
+     * InflaterInputStream.read(byte[], int, int)}).
+     *

@@ -170,4 +170,12 @@ - * Reads from the current JAR file entry into an array of bytes. - * If {@code len} is not zero, the method - * blocks until some input is available; otherwise, no - * bytes are read and {@code 0} is returned. + * Reads from the current ZIP entry into an array of bytes, returning the number of + * inflated bytes. If {@code len} is not zero, the method blocks until some input is + * available; otherwise, no bytes are read and {@code 0} is returned. + *

+ * If the current entry is compressed and n denotes a nonzero number of inflated + * bytes to return, then {@code b[off]} trough {@code b[off+}n{@code -1]} will + * contain the uncompressed data. The elements {@code b[off+}n{@code ]} through + * {@code b[off+}len{@code -1]} are undefined (an implementation is free to + * change them during the inflate operation). If the return value is -1 or an exception + * is thrown, then the content of {@code b[off]} to {@code b[off+}len{@code -1]} + * is undefined. + *

If {@code len} is not - * zero, the method will block until some input can be decompressed; otherwise, - * no bytes are read and {@code 0} is returned. + * Reads uncompressed data into an array of bytes, returning the number of inflated + * bytes. If {@code len} is not zero, the method will block until some input can be + * decompressed; otherwise, no bytes are read and {@code 0} is returned. + *

+ * If n denotes a nonzero number of inflated bytes to return, then {@code buf[off]} + * through {@code buf[off+}n{@code -1]} will contain the uncompressed data. The + * elements {@code buf[off+}n{@code ]} through {@code buf[off+}len{@code -1]} + * are undefined (an implementation is free to change them during the inflate + * operation). If the return value is -1 or an exception is thrown, then the content of + * {@code buf[off]} to {@code buf[off+}len{@code -1]} is undefined. + * @@ -99,1 +107,1 @@ - * @param off the start offset in the destination array {@code b} + * @param off the start offset in the destination array {@code buf} @@ -101,1 +109,1 @@ - * @return the actual number of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the + * @return the actual number of inflated bytes, or -1 if the end of the
